page.title: 03The Tame Road,Witton.
page.content: The River Tame was the main factor for the growth in industry and housing in the Tame Road area.There are a large number of small factories which use,or used,the canal and the main road in the north,or the rail and new expressway in the south.There is evidence of many changes:-of houses converting to shops; of large firms becoming smaller;of waste land being used for car parks and new industrial estates,situated behind existing factories or housing;and of large buildings being converted into several small firms,many of which are conected with small metal industry. Shopping facilities reflect this change from the video film library to the old corner general stores.Two cafes and a chip shop in Tame Road itself cater for the needs of the workers,as well as the residents.Despite the developments,the housing looks clean and well cared for.
